thread.title: Stars to hold Hockey Fights Cancer Night Saturday; jerseys will be auctioned for charity
thread.title_full: Stars to hold Hockey Fights Cancer Night Saturday; jerseys will be auctioned for charity | Dallas Morning News

author: Mike Heika
title: Stars to hold Hockey Fights Cancer Night Saturday; jerseys will be auctioned for charity
text:
PITTSBURGH -- The Stars will hold their annual Hockey Fights Cancer Night Saturday when the Florida Panthers are in town.
As a tribute to those battling cancer, the Stars will encourage fans to write-in the name of a person that inspires them on a card and the names will be used during an in-game tribute. All members of the Dallas Stars coaching staff will wear Hockey Fights Cancer ties on the bench during the game and Dallas Stars players will wear lavender jerseys during warmups. The ties and jerseys will be auctioned for charity.
Bekki Nill, the wife of Stars general manager Jim Nill, will participate in the ceremonial puck drop and host a suite for breast cancer fighters and survivors. Bekki Nill was diagnosed with breast cancer 15 years ago and continues to undergo treatment.
